text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.3.27, IDRS Terminal Responses, Command Code ECREQ.
2.3.27.1 Editorial changes were made to add internal controls.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I
Table of Contents
This IRM and the contained subsections provide the user the necessary infor- mation on how to use Command Code ECREQ

Use Command Code ECREQ to request a screen format to input state em- ployment commission requests on IMF taxpayers present on the TIF (Taxpayer Information File) on the IDRS (Integrated Data Retrieval System).
) Code ECREQ (

) Command Code ECREQ creates a record that will be sent to state agencies for potential levy sources. These records will be sent to each participating agency within the service center jurisdiction or only to the speciﬁc states select. Since the state’s records are updated quarterly, determine if you need to re-input the request. Command Code ECREQ request a screen format input state employment commission requests one of the following formats: ECREQ
, ECREQP or ECREQM. (
) Precede CC ECREQ with CC LEVYS to avoid duplication of effort and to insure no levy source already exists. (
) Command Code ECREQP requests produce a hardcopy listing. ECREQ, ECREQ
, or ECREQM requests will be updated to the TIF. (
) Command Code ECREQ with a blank, P or
deﬁner will result in the ECREQ
format, (
) Command Code ECREQ with a deﬁner of M will result in the ECREQM (
) ECREQ
and ECREQP will generate up to
separate taxpayer requests the states selected. (
) ECREQM will generate up to
separate taxpayer requests. One request each line of valid input will be sent to all states within the service center diction. Because of processing costs, avoid indiscriminate use of CC ECREQM. (
) If you are inputting CC ECREQP, and you are not the originator of the EC request, enter the originator’s RECEIVER-EMPLOYEE-NUMBER on line
, positions
) You may enter both the primary and secondary SSNs on the same request, although only the primary SSN is required. The taxpayer name control is a required input. (
) FUNCTIONAL-AREA-CODE is an optional ﬁeld. Enter the correct value on
, position
, if the request is not for Collection. (
) Tabbing to the ﬁrst position of each input ﬁeld has been added. See record element description.
) Responses For CC (
) Error messages will be displayed in inverse video on line
Correct the and re-enter. (
) Error Messages: a. “CC-DEFINER INV”—The CC-DEFINER is not blank, M,

or P. b. “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA ON SCREEN”—all elements mined to be invalid on the request screen will be asterisk and displayed for correction and re-entry. All elements on the request screen deter- mined to be valid will not be returned, they will be processed and to the gendata tape. c. “ERROR ON WRITE TO GENDATA-NOTIFY CSA”—The request tions on the screen have not been written to tape. CSA should correct tape problem. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
F (
a. “CC-DEFINER INV”—The CC-DEFINER is not blank, M,

or P. b. “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA ON SCREEN”—all elements deter- mined to be invalid on the request screen will be asterisk and displayed for correction and re-entry. All elements on the request screen deter- mined to be valid will not be returned, they will be processed and written to the gendata tape. c. “ERROR ON WRITE TO GENDATA-NOTIFY CSA”—The request transac- tions on the screen have not been written to tape. CSA should correct tape problem.
) ECREQ Valid Response (
) If Command Code ECREQ (with a deﬁner of blank,
, P, or M) is input correctly, the format for ECREQ
or ECREQM will be generated. (
) If ECREQ
, ECREQP OR ECREQM data is input correctly, the input screen will be returned with the message “REQUEST COMPLETE” on line
If ECREQ5, ECREQP OR ECREQM data is input correctly, the input screen will be returned with the message “REQUEST COMPLETE” on line 24.

RECEIVER-EMPLOYEE-NUM (used for routing): nnnnnnnnnn or [slashb] will be input only if the receiver of the state info is other than the terminal operator. First 2 positions must be valid Service Center or District Office code, within Service Center’s jurisdiction. Last eight positions may not be all zeroes.
0=Collection (default value)
